instruction: How do I contact the Computer Science Department at Missouri State University?
response:
Computer Science Department Contact:
• Address: 901 S. National, Springfield MO 65897
• Phone: (417) 836-4157
• Email: ComputerScience@missouristate.edu
• Website: www.cs.missouristate.edu

instruction: Is the CS program at MSU accredited?
response: Yes, the Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Computer Science Option (ABET Accredited) is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

instruction: What is the Successful completion of the computer science major field test (MFT) for CS at MSU?
response: Must achieve at least a score of 50th percentile.

instruction: What is the Minimum Total Hours for CS at MSU?
response: At least 120 hours of courses must be taken to graduate.

instruction: What is the Minimum Upper-Level Hours for CS at MSU?
response: At least 40 hours of courses must be numbered 300 and above.

instruction: What are the CS elective options at Missouri State University?
response:
Choose 9 hours from among the following courses.

Options: CSC 300, CSC 330, CSC 388, CSC 399, CSC/MTH 421, CSC/MTH 422, CSC 455, CSC 515, CSC 521, CSC 525, CSC 526, CSC 534, CSC 535, CSC 538, CSC 540, CSC 545, CSC 567, CSC 590, CSC 596

Note: No more than three hours can count from CSC 399 and no more than 3 hours can count from CSC 596.
MTH 261 (Calculus I) is a 5-credit course at Missouri State University.
MTH 261 is 5 credit hours.
MTH 280 (Calculus II) is a 5-credit course at Missouri State University. Prerequisites: MTH 261.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for MTH 280?
response: The prerequisites for MTH 280 (Calculus II) are: MTH 261.
MTH 280 is 5 credit hours.
